space.arim.bans.api

Interface ArimBansLibrary

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, space.arim.bans.api.PunishmentPlugin, space.arim.universal.registry.Registrable, space.arim.api.sql.SQLPlugin

    public interface ArimBansLibrary
extends space.arim.bans.api.PunishmentPlugin, space.arim.api.sql.SQLPlugin, AutoCloseable

    • Field Detail

      • INVALID_STRING_CODE

        static final String INVALID_STRING_CODE
        Used internally for invalid messages. If you send a message whose sole content is this, you will receive an unchecked exception.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • checkString

        static boolean checkString(String message)
        Checks a message for validity

        All this does is:
        1. Check against INVALID_STRING_CODE for equality
        2. Check for null values
        Parameters:
        message - - the string to check
        Returns:
        true if valid

      • getNextAvailablePunishmentId

        int getNextAvailablePunishmentId()

      • fromUUID

        space.arim.bans.api.Subject fromUUID(UUID uuid)
        Gets a Subject from a UUID
        Parameters:
        uuid - - the uuid to turn into a subject
        Returns:
        Subject representing the player UUID

      • fromIpAddress

        space.arim.bans.api.Subject fromIpAddress(String address)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a Subject from an IP Address

        Use checkAddress(String) to validate the address first.
        Parameters:
        address - - the address to use
        Returns:
        a Subject representing the address
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if address is invalid

      • parseSubject

        space.arim.bans.api.Subject parseSubject(String input)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a Subject from arbitrary user input

        Will automatically detect if IP address or UUID. Short UUIDs will be automatically expanded.
        Parameters:
        input - - the String to convert to a Subject
        Returns:
        Subject representing the input specified
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if input does not match to any type of Subject

      • simulateCommand

        void simulateCommand(space.arim.bans.api.Subject subject,
                     space.arim.bans.api.CommandType command,
                     String[] args)
        Simulates execution of a command
        Parameters:
        subject - - the player (or console) executing the command
        command - - the command to be executed
        args - - additional arguments

      • simulateCommand

        void simulateCommand(space.arim.bans.api.Subject subject,
                     String[] rawArgs)
        Simulates execution of a command. Differs from simulateCommand(Subject, CommandType, String[]) in that it automatically parses command types.

        Example usage if banLib represents an ArimBansLibrary object:
        banLib.simulateCommand(banLib.fromUUID("some uuid"), "ipban player15 19d ip-banned for 19 days!);
        Parameters:
        subject - - the player (or console) executing the command
        rawArgs - - the arguments including the command itself

      • changeReason

        void changeReason(space.arim.bans.api.Punishment punishment,
                  String reason)
           throws space.arim.bans.api.exception.MissingPunishmentException
        Changes a punishment reason
        Parameters:
        punishment - - the punishment whose reason to change
        reason - - the new reason
        Throws:
        space.arim.bans.api.exception.MissingPunishmentException - if the punishment is neither found in active punishments nor history

      • async

        void async(Runnable task)
        Executes a block of code asynchronously.

        Bukkit/Spigot users may call Bukkit.getScheduler().runTask(Plugin, Runnable) to resynchronize.
        Parameters:
        task - - the lambda/runnable to run async

      • reload

        void reload()
        Reloads whole plugin configuration, including config.yml and messages.yml

        void reloadConfig()
        Reloads functional configuration (config.yml)

      • reloadMessages

        void reloadMessages()
        Reloads message configuration (messages.yml)

      • checkAddress

        default boolean checkAddress(String address)
        Checks to ensure an address is valid.

        Relies on InetAddress.isInetAddress
        Parameters:
        address - - the address to check
        Returns:
        true if the address is valid, false otherwise
